About

WebSocket is a protocol providing full-duplex communications channels over a single TCP connection. The WebSocket protocol was standardized by the IETF as RFC 6455 in 2011, and the WebSocket API in Web IDL is being standardized by the W3C.

Where we use it

We use websockets for the server to client communication for the Freetable Chat server.

Why we use it

Websockets use very little overhead to achieve what would take a massive amount of overhead using polling methods.

External Links

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WebSocket
